In the instant case the main witness was: In Sunil Vs AG 1999  (3) SLR page 191 it was held;

column2: It is  trite  law  that  the  trial  Judge  who  hears  a  bribery  trial  is  entitled
to convict  on  the  sole  testimony  of  a  prosecution  witness  without  any
corroboration  provided  he  is  impressed  with  the  cogency,    convincing
